oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis transformed into fatal mucous impaction by immune reconstitution in an AIDS patient
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Sambatakou, H
Denning, David W.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: theme:invasion impact
patient
invasive pulmonary aspergillosis
invasion impact
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Springer Science and Business Media LLC
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reported here is the case of a newly diagnosed AIDS patient with end-stage HIV infection and biopsy-proven invasive pulmonary aspergillosis who responded to antifungal therapy but developed severe mucous impaction in association with rapid immune restoration that was ultimately fatal. Invasive pulmonary aspergillosis complicates about 4% of AIDS infections. A search of the medical literature revealed no previous report of this organism's involvement in immune restoration syndrome.
